meanings.definition: Characteristic of a toady; fawning or obsequious.
meanings.sent1: The toadyish man complimented his boss excessively to gain favor.
meanings.sent2: She noticed his toadyish behavior when he constantly agreed with everything the supervisor said.
meanings.sent3: The toadyish waiter showered the celebrity with compliments, hoping for a big tip.
meanings.sent4: Her toadyish attitude towards the teacher made her unpopular among her classmates.
meanings.sent5: The toadyish smile on his face revealed his insincerity.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a servile or sycophantic manner.
meanings.sent1: He acted toadyish around his wealthy relatives, hoping for financial gain.
meanings.sent2: The toadyish assistant always agreed with the manager, even when he knew she was wrong.
meanings.sent3: The toadyish behavior of the salesperson made the customers uncomfortable.
meanings.sent4: Her toadyish flattery towards the professor was transparent to everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The toadyish student constantly praised the teacher in hopes of getting better grades.
